Scopenote: Three leading physicists (L-R), Ernest O. Lawrence, Enrico Fermi, and Isidor I. Rabi, gather at Los Alamos National Laboratory during their work on the atomic bomb (Manhattan Project).

title: African-American and white soldiers during World War II
Scopenote: Stressing the need for interracial solidarity in the post-war world, African-American and white soldiers got together as part of the army's general educational program at a heavy bomber base in Italy.  Arranged by Colonel David C. Epps (third from left standing) of Portland, Oregon, the participants heard informal speeches by 2nd Lieutenant Sidney Thompson, Jr, (to right of Epps) of Cleveland, Ohio; S/Sgt. Ernest J. Henderson (second from left sitting in second row) of Springfield, Massachusetts and Sergeant Robert Williams (extreme right, foreground) of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: World War II soldiers with captured Nazi flag
Scopenote: Co. brought to this country to tell civilians about the German counter offensive in the Ardennes, and well qualified to do the job, the group shown above, holding a captured Nazi Swastika, will tour the Sixth Service Command, making talks to war workers urging them to increase the output of vital war supplies. Left to right, they are: Sgt. Frederick R. Wheeler, Charleston, S.C.; Sgt. Hugh D. Thompson, Lufkin, Texas; Sgt. Samuel B. Hendrix, Claxton, Ga., 1st Lieut. Walter J. McDowell, Hackensack., N.J.; Capt. James H., Cruickshank, Elizabeth, N.J.; Sgt. James E. Colucci, Niagara Falls, N.Y.; Cpl. Henry C. Cogola, Chicago, Ill.; Sgt. Elmer K. Forrest, Princeton, Ill.

title: Soldiers returned from Bastogne, France
Scopenote: Soldiers with Nazi souvenirs from in and around Bastogne, France.  Standing: Sgt. Sandy E. Wyatt, New York, New York; First Lieutenant Clair L. Hess, Blairsville, Pennsylvania; Tech. 5th Grade John H. Shaw, Franksville, New York; Staff Sgt. Robert Clifford, Grand Saline, Texas; Tech. 5th Grade Thomas W. Stephens, Hornbeck, Louisiana; Sgt. Stanley P. Koss, Corpus Christi, Texas; Captain Edward W. Cissel, Elizabeth, New Jersey.  Kneeling: Sgt. Franklin D. Hendricks, South Boston, Virginia.  These soldiers were brought back to this country to participate in a speaking program for factory workers on the urgency of speeding up the output of vital war supplies.  They toured key war plants in principal cities of the Second Service Command.

title: Bodies of dead children
Scopenote: Bodies of dead children found in concentration camp at Nordhausen lie in mass burial grave.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Truck loaded with dead bodies from concentration camp
Scopenote: Truck loaded with dead bodies; most cases were caused from starvation and typhus. This photo is one of a group of photographs taken in German prison camps at Belsen, Germany where the German Gestapo and S. S. Troops tortured and starved many thousands of political prisoners.    From album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies of Jewish slave laborers outside Neunberg
Scopenote: Bodies of Jewish slave laborers in woods outside Neunberg, where they were marched from a Nazi Gestapo camp. Civilians of town were ordered to disinter and rebury victims in the city cemetery.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Capt. William T. Drake examines tubercular laborer
Scopenote: Capt. William T. Drake, Commanding Officer, examines tubercular Russian slave laborer at the displaced persons center in Dortmund, Germany.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Nazi prisoner of war camp in Germany
Scopenote: The "hospital" section of a Nazi prisoner of war camp in Germany.  Six men were placed in each tier.  The man on the lower tier is dead.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German slave labor camp victim
Scopenote: Lifeless eyes stare from the broken, starved body of a slave found by American 3rd Armored Division, First Army, when it captured a German slave labor camp near Nordhausen.  Hundreds of emaciated bodies covered barracks where Russians, Polish, French, Belgian and Italian captives lived with their dead.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Concentration camp victims
Scopenote: A truck load of bodies of prisoners in a German concentration camp at Weimar, Germany.  The bodies were about to be disposed of by burning, when the camp was captured by troops of the 3rd United States Army.  From: album entitled: "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Ohrdurf concentration camp victims
Scopenote: Physical evidence of malnutrition in one of the prisoners murdered by fleeing Nazis before the Ohrdurf concentration camp was captured by Third Army troops.  From: album entitled: "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Wobbelin concentration camp victim
Scopenote: This victim that was dug-up from a mass grave near the Wobbelin concentration camp. Civilians of the nearby town of Ludwigslust were ordered by 82nd Airborne Division Troops to exhume the bodies of Nazi atrocity victims and rebury them in the town square. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German civilians exhuming bodies
Scopenote: Civilians of Ludwigslust, Germany, and nearby communities, were forced to exhume bodies of concentration camp victims from mass grave and prepare them for reburial.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany
Scopenote: American troops discovered these bodies piled in one of the barracks at the concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Division, 9th U S Army.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies of German political prisoners
Scopenote: Bodies of German political prisoners who were shot by Nazis and thrown into a common grave.  Bodies were reburied at Ohligs in a public place as a permanent reminder to the German people of the atrocities.  The burial was supervised by the Graves Registration section of the 94th Division.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Flossenburg concentration camp victims
Scopenote: Bodies of Jewish, French, Russian and slave laborers who died at the Flossenburg concentration camp, Flossenburg, Germany.  Note lettering on chest of body in foreground.  Camp was discovered by the 97th Infantry Division, Third U S Army.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Victim at Neunberg
Scopenote: This victim of S. S. torture death at Neunberg had half his forearm missing; had little medical attention before he was killed in woods.  Bodies of camp victims were disinterred and reburied in the city cemetery by local civilians.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Nazi prison camp at Belsen, Germany
Scopenote: Body of man found dead at side of road in former Nazi prison camp at Belsen, Germany.  The man died of starvation.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German citizens digging graves
Scopenote: Citizens of Ludwigslust, Germany, under order of 82nd Airborne Division troops dig graves in the town square for victims found unburied in nearby Wobbelin concentration camp.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German civilians preparing bodies for burial
Scopenote: German civilians of Neunberg pick up bodies of concentration camp victims outside Neunberg, and remove them to the city cemetery for burial under orders of the XII corps officers.  Victims were Russian and Polish Jews and were shot by S. S. Troops.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Nazi prison camp at Belsen, Germany
Scopenote: Huge pile of shoes taken off dead in former Nazi prison camp at Belsen, Germany.  The camp was under the direction of the British 2nd Army after liberation.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Civilians carrying coffins
Scopenote: Neunberg, Germany.  Civilians carry empty boxes up a hill to get bodies of 120 victims killed by S. S. troops in a wooded area.  Townspeople were forced to carry them to the cemetery for proper burial.  They spent two days building the boxes.  Chaplains of 3rd U. S. Army held short services for Protestant, Catholic, and Jewish victims.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Site of mass burning of slave laborers
Scopenote: Site of mass burning of 250 Polish and French slave laborers at Nazi camp near Leipzig on April 19, 1945, the day before the city was captured by the 69th Div. of the U.S. First Army. The victims were herded into a building. A time bomb was exploded. Men who broke doors down to escape were machine gunned by Nazi S.S. troops. From: album entitled: "Nazi War Atrocities." This album was presented to President Truman by the Army Pictorial Service.

title: Bodies of Victims of a Mass Burning
Scopenote: Two surviving prisoners walk among bodies of victims of mass burning of slave laborers at a Nazi camp near Leipzig on April 19, 1945, the day before the city was captured by the 69th Div. of the U.S. First Army.  The victims were herded into a building and a time bomb was exploded.  Men who broke doors down to escape were machine gunned by Nazi S.S. troops.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower standing beside a gallows
Scopenote: Standing beside a gallows, Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower, Supreme Allied Commander, listens while occupants of a former German concentration camp tell, through an interpreter, of atrocities committed by Nazis operating the camp. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Hospital cribs at Buchenwald concentration camp
Scopenote: Prisoners in the "hospital" cribs at Buchenwald concentration camp.  This photo is one of a group of photographs taken shortly after the liberation of the infamous camp near Weimar, Germany. The photographs were taken by a rehabilitation officer of the U.S. Army Chief Surgeon's office when he arrived at the camp three days after Weimar was taken by the U.S. Third Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Russian, Polish and Dutch slave laborers
Scopenote: These Russian, Polish and Dutch slave laborers interned at the Buchenwald concentration camp averaged 160 pounds each prior to entering the camp.  Their average weight after 11 months of imprisonment was 70 pounds.  U.S. troops of the 80th Division liberated the camp.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Prisoners at Ludwigslust concentration camp
Scopenote: Body of dead prisoner in the Nazi camp at Ludwigslust lies on the floor amidst other prisoners. 150 were reported to have died daily.  From: album entitled "Nazi Atrocities."

title: Bodies of dead inmates fill yard
Scopenote: Rows of bodies of dead inmates fill yard of Lager Nordhausen, a Gestapo Concentration Camp near Nordhausen, Germany.  The photograph, according to the cameraman, shows less than half of the bodies of the several hundred inmates who died of starvation or were shot by Gestapo men at the camp.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Russian prisoner of war
Scopenote: Liberated Russian prisoner showing where S. S. troops beat him about the legs with lead filled leather whip. This is one of a series of pictures taken at a German concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany, after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Division, 9th US Army. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities.

title: Prisoners at camp in Wobbelin, Germany
Scopenote: Liberated prisoners in Wobbelin, Germany. This is one of a series of pictures taken at a German concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Division, 9th US Army. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Stalag Tekla Massacre victim
Scopenote: A political prisoner ran into this barbed wire, was shot through the head, and his clothing burned from his body during his attempt to flee the S.S. Troops at Stalag Tekla near Leipzig, Germany. The camp prisoners were placed in a building that was then set on fire by S. S. troops. Anyone attempting to escape the building was shot. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Camp Buchenwald cremation furnaces
Scopenote: Camp Buchenwald furnaces are viewed by civilians of Weimar, forced by United States Third Army Military Police to walk through the camp to view the Nazi atrocities.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Victims of Nazi camps near Leipzig
Scopenote: Site of mass burning of 250 Polish and French slave laborers at Nazi camp near Leipzig on April 19, 1945, the day before the city was captured by the 69th Div. of the U.S. First Army. The victims were herded into a building. A time bomb was exploded. Men who broke doors down to escape were machine gunned by Nazi S.S. troops. From: album entitled: Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Furnaces at Buchenwald concentration camp
Scopenote: Charred bodies in furnaces found by U S troops of the 80th Div., at Buchenwald concentration camp near Jena, Germany.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Concentration camp victims near Leipzig
Scopenote: Victims of mass burning of 250 Polish and French slave laborers at a Nazi camp near Leipzig on April 19, l945, the day before city was captured by the 69th Division, of U S First Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German concentration camp inmates
Scopenote: Wobbelin, Germany, concentration camp inmates after the camp's capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Division, 9th United States Army.    From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bergen-Belsen victims
Scopenote: Political prisoners who died at Bergen-Belsen prison camp in Germany, before the allies could liberate them.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Jewish slave laborer killed by Nazi guard
Scopenote: Battered shoulder of Jewish slave laborer killed by his Nazi guard at Neunberg.  Bodies were disinterred and reburied in the city cemetery by the town's civilians.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Cremating oven at Bergen-Belsen
Scopenote: Cremating oven where a dozen or more bodies were burned at a time in former Nazi prison at Bergen-Belsen. Some prisoners were even burned alive.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities"

title: Citizens of Neunburg, Germany
Scopenote: Women and men of Neunburg bear bodies of 120 S. S. shooting victims to burial in the city cemetery after removal of bodies from woodland shooting site outside town.  Chaplains of U. S. Third Army conducted services for victims.  From: album entitled \Nazi War Atrocities.\""""""

title: Germans digging graves
Scopenote: Former German police of Ludwigslust, Germany, under order of 82nd Airborne Division, dig graves in the town square for German atrocity victims found in nearby concentration camp. From: album entitles "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German citizens carrying a coffin
Scopenote: On orders of the XII corps Military Government officials, German citizens of the town of Neunburg, Germany, dug up the bodies of the murdered Polish and Russian Jews from where the S. S. troopers buried them and gave them a decent burial in the town cemetery.  Here citizens carry one of the dead.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies in at Gardelegen, Germany
Scopenote: In a large barn on the edge of Gardelegen, Germany, at least 150 Russian, French, Polish, and Jewish political prisoners of Nazi Germany were burned to death by S. S. Troops.  The atrocity was exposed when the 9th U S Army captured the Gardelegen area before the Germans had time to remove the evidence.  Pictured here are a few victims who made a last struggle for life.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Body of a concentration camp prisoner
Scopenote: The body of a concentration camp prisoner showing extreme emaciation.  The prisoner had just died from starvation and was being hauled to the incinerator.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Prisoners pose in liberated Nazi concentration camp
Scopenote: Starved prisoners, nearly dead from hunger, pose in Nazi concentration camp in Ebensee, Austria.  In the Austrian Alps the Nazis had one of their largest camps.  Large numbers of inmates were starving to death and dying at the rate of 2000 per week.  The camp was reputedly used for "scientific" experiments.  It was liberated by the 80th Division, 3rd U.S. Army.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Dwight D. Eisenhower touring a liberated concentration camp
Scopenote: Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower, Supreme Allied Commander, watches while former occupants of a German concentration camp at Gotha demonstrate how they were tortured by the Nazis operating the camp. General Eisenhower visited the camp during a tour of the Third Army Front. General Omar N. Bradley, 12th Army Group CG, and Lt. General George S. Patton, 3rd Army CG, are at Eisenhower's right.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies awaiting mass burial
Scopenote: Bodies awaiting burial at the "Lager-Nordhausen" concentration camp in Nordhausen, Germany. German civilians were drafted to help in burying the dead. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies piled in a shed
Scopenote: A group of bodies piled in a shed at a concentration camp near Ohrdruf, Germany. The camp was discovered when Third US Army troops took the town of Ohrdruf.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Nazi concentration camp survivors
Scopenote: Hungry prisoners eat food picked up from a farm near Mauthasen concentration camp, near Lintz, Austria.  Prisoners were liberated by the cavalry of 11th Armored Division, 3rd US Army.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German citizens visit concentration camp
Scopenote: Citizens of Ludwigslust, Germany, tour a nearby concentration camp under orders of the 82 Airborne.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Concentration camp at Wobbelin, Germany
Scopenote: The toilets at a concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany.  The camp was captured by troops of the 82nd Airborne Division, 9th U. S. Army.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Burned body at Gardenlegen, Germany
Scopenote: In a large barn just at the edge of Gardenlegen, Germany, political prisoners were burned to death by S. S. troops in an attempt to remove "evidence" in the face of the advancing Allied forces. The 9th U S Army troops captured the Gardenlegen area before the Germans had time to bury all the dead.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies near Ohligs, Germany
Scopenote: Bodies of political prisoners shot by Nazis and buried in a mass grave near Ohligs, Germany. Under the supervision of the Graves Registration Unit of the 94th Division, the citizens of Ohligs exhumed the bodies and buried each individually in coffins.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German slave labor camp at Nordhausen
Scopenote: Prisoners of war found by American 3rd Armored Div., 1st Army, when it captured the German slave labor camp at Nordhausen.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies of political prisoners near Ohligs, Germany
Scopenote: Bodies of political prisoners shot by Nazis and buried in a mass grave near Ohligs, Germany.  The bodies were exhumed by the citizens of Ohligs under the supervision of the graves registration unit of the 94th Division.  The bodies were placed in coffins made by the citizens and were buried individually.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German civilians at Gardelegen camp
Scopenote: German civilians place victim of Gardelegen camp on litter for burial under supervision of military government.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies of political prisoners
Scopenote: Burned and half-burned bodies of political prisoners of the Nazis lie heaped about the entrance to a barn at Gardelegen, Germany, where they met their death at the hands of S. S. troops, who set the barn afire.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Heap of ashes and bones
Scopenote: This heap of ashes and bones represents only one day's killing of prisoners by S. S. troops in the German concentration camp at Weimar, Germany, captured by troops of the 3rd U S Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies in the Belgian snow
Scopenote: Atrocities committed by German troops in the vicinity of Five Points, near Malmedy, Belgium, on or about December 17, 1944. Photographs made after recapture of ground and exhumation of bodies. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Mutilated body near Malmedy, Belgium
Scopenote: Atrocities committed by German troops in the vicinity of Five Points, near Malmedy, Belgium, on or about December 17, 1944.  Photograph made after recapture of ground and exhumation of bodies.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: United States Army commanders viewing charred bodies of prisoners
Scopenote: Charred bodies of prisoners burned in the concentration camp at Gotha, Germany, are viewed by General Dwight D. Eisenhower, Supreme Allied Commander, and a party of high ranking U.S. Army officers. In the group are: General Omar N. Bradley, C.G., 12th Army Group; Lt. General George S. Patton, C.G., 3rd U.S. Army; and Maj. General Manton Eddy, C.G., 12th Corps. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Women political prisoners at Belsen, Germany
Scopenote: Women political prisoners, freed by advancing allied armies at their German prison camp at Belsen, Germany, wash their teeth with utensils supplied by their liberators.  One woman at left is chopping up a door for fire wood.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German Concentration Camp in Wobbelin, Germany
Scopenote: Concentration camp prisoners drinking and washing from one of the camp's pumps. This is one of the series of pictures taken at German concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany, after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Div., 9th US army.

title: Prisoners at Buchenwald concentration camp
Scopenote: After being liberated, prisoners at Buchenwald concentration camp near Weimar, Germany managed to find a little food. This photo is one of a series of photographs taken by a rehabilitation officer of the U S. Army Chief Surgeon's office, when he arrived at the camp three days after Weimar was taken by the U S. Third Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Nazi prison camp at Belsen, Germany
Scopenote: Prisoners' quarters at the former Nazi prison camp at Belsen, Germany.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Dead at the concentration camp at Gotha, Germany
Scopenote: These emaciated, nude corpses, stacked like cord-wood in a bin at the concentration camp at Gotha, Germany were strewn with quicklime in a hap-hazarded attempt to destroy evidence.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Dead at Lager-Nordhausen concentration camp
Scopenote: Bodies of hundreds of slave laborers of all nationalities lay in the yard at Lager-Nordhausen concentration camp.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Lager-Nordhausen concentration camp victim
Scopenote: Mutilated body of a slave laborer at Lager-Nordhausen concentration camp.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Wobbelin concentration camp in Germany
Scopenote: This line of dead inmates was found in one of the camp's washrooms when American Troops entered the camp. This is one of a series of pictures taken at Wobbelin concentration camp in Germany, after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Div., 9th U S Army. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Concentration camp victims near Leipzig
Scopenote: Victims of mass burning of 250 Polish and French slave laborers at a Nazi camp near Leipzig on April 19, l945, the day before city was captured by the 69th Division of US First Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities"

title: German slave labor camp victims
Scopenote: A pile of dead prisoners found by American Third Armored Division, Fusa, when it captured the German slave labor camp at Nordhausen.  Hundred of emaciated bodies covered the barracks.    From: album entitled: "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies at Buchenwald
Scopenote: Large pile of bodies at Buchenwald concentration camp. The Nazis ran out of coal and were unable to cremate bodies before the camp was taken by General Patton's Third Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Women's barracks at Belsen, Germany
Scopenote: Interior of women's barracks in Nazi camp at Belsen, Germany.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Jewish laborer killed by S. S. Guards at Nuenberg
Scopenote: Battered head of Jewish laborer killed by S. S. guards at Neunberg.  Bodies of victims were disinterred and reburied by civilians of Neunberg under U.S. Army direction.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Female inmates at Mauthasen concentration camp
Scopenote: Emaciated, sick women prisoners lie in hospital bunks of Mauthasen concentration camp near Lintz, Austria.  Camp was liberated by cavalry of the 11th Armored Division, 3rd Army, shortly before the end of war in Europe.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German prisoners remove dead
Scopenote: German soldiers, prisoners of the 71st Infantry Division, 3rd U S Army, remove dead victims from a concentration camp and prepare to bury them.  This camp near Lambach, Austria, originally held over 18,000 people each building holding 1,600.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German civilians of Neunberg make coffins
Scopenote: PFC Gustave Anderson, Lynn, Massachusetts, an MP with the XII Corps Headquarters, supervises German civilians of Neunberg making coffins for victims of mass murder of S. S. camp laborers.  Bodies of victims were disinterred and reburied in the city cemetery by civilians.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German civilians at memorial services at Neunberg
Scopenote: German civilians listen to memorial services for victims of concentration camp shootings by S. S. troopers at Neunberg.  Bodies of victims were carried by civilians from the woodland shooting site into the city for burial in the town cemetery.  US Third Army chaplains conducted the services.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German civilians of Gardelegen
Scopenote: German civilians of Gardelegen prepare to march with wooden crosses from military government office to the concentration camp a mile distant where they were ordered to inter the bodies of the camp's victims.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Clay urns at Belsen, Germany
Scopenote: Underground room at former Nazi prison camp at Belsen, Germany.  The room is filled with clay urns in which remains of cremated victims were sometimes placed.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Civilians carrying coffins to burial ground
Scopenote: Neunburg, Germany:  Citizens of Neunburg and surrounding towns bear 120 victims of S. S. trooper killings to burial ground after bodies were picked up in woods where they fell to Nazi bullets.  Chaplains of U. S. Third Army held short services for Protestant, Catholic, and Jewish victims.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Nazi "souvenirs" from concentration camp
Scopenote: Exhibit of "souvenirs" created by Nazis in Buchenwald concentration camp, near Weimar. They were seized by General Patton's Third Army. German civilians were brought from town to gaze upon shrunken human heads (left) parts of organs of victims who died of various diseases, and stenciling and tattoo markings on sections of human skin (foreground). Lamp at right was fabricated from skin of camp's dead. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German civilians viewing dead prisoners
Scopenote: German civilians of Weimar witness a truckload of prisoners dead at Buchenwald concentration camp.  The civilians were forced by the U.S. Third Army Military Police to witness evidence of atrocities at the camp.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Barracks in Ohrdurf concentration camp
Scopenote: Barracks in which prisoners were housed in the Nazi concentration camp at Ohrdurf, Germany.  From album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Living quarters of a German Concentration Camp
Scopenote: A dead inmate lies in the prisoners' living quarters. This one of a series of pictures taken at a German Concentration Camp in Wobbelin, Germany after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Div., 9th US Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Victim of a concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany
Scopenote: This is one of a series of pictures at a German concentration camp in Wobbelin, Germany after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Division, 9th U S Army.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Victim of the German SS Troopers
Scopenote: This slave laborer was burned and machine gunned to death by German S. S. Troopers at Leipzig, Germany, on April 19, l945, the day before the city was captured by infantrymen of the 69th Division, 1st United States Army.    From: album entitled:  "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Dead at Mauthasen concentration camp
Scopenote: Bodies of dead prisoners are heaped on ground at Mauthasen concentration camp near Lintz, Austria. Camp was captured by cavalry of 11th Armored Division, 3rd United States Army, shortly before the end of war in Europe. From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies of concentration camp victims
Scopenote: Dozens of bodies of concentration camp victims.  Charred bodies lay among the dead.  From: album entitled: "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Gardelegen camp victims
Scopenote: Mass victims taken from Gardelegen camp by German civilians for burial nearby under supervision of 102nd Division of Ninth United States Army.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies of Russian prisoners of war
Scopenote: Bodies of over 200 Russian prisoners of war await burial by German prisoners of war near Hemer, Germany. The bodies were discovered in a building of Stalag VI A by the 99th Infantry Division, 1st U S Army.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: German citizens exhuming bodies from a mass grave
Scopenote: Schwarzenfeld, Germany.  German civilians exhuming bodies of Polish Jews shot by S. S. troops during a forced march away from advancing American forces. They were shot just days before the 26th Infantry Division, 3rd U S Army took the town.  The American officers ordered the civilians to exhume and individually bury the victims.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Mass grave at Bergen-Belsen
Scopenote: One of the huge mass graves at Bergen-Belsen prison camp.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Dead concentration camp victims
Scopenote: Dead victims of the Germans were removed for burial from a concentration camp just north of Lambach, Austria, by German soldiers under orders of 3rd U S Army troops.    From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Camp survivors at Wobbelin, Germany
Scopenote: Survivors at a concentration camp at Wobbelin, Germany after its capture by troops of the 82nd Airborne Division, 9th U S Army.  An inmate breaks out in tears when he finds he is not leaving with the first group to the hospital.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Concentration camp victims at Ebensee, Austria
Scopenote: In the Austrian Alps at Ebensee, Austria, the Nazis had one of their largest concentration camps. Shown here are prisoners taking dead bodies from the hospital. The camp was liberated by the 80th Division, 3rd U S Army.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Services for Nazi shooting victims
Scopenote: Neunberg, Germany:  Services were held for 120 victims of S. S. trooper shooting at Neunberg, by U. S. Third Army chaplains, as townspeople look on.  The German civilians were ordered to build coffins for the victims and to bring them from the woodland shooting site to the cemetery for burial.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Bodies of Nazi victims
Scopenote: Battered bodies of Jewish slave laborers from the S. S. camp at Neunburg, Germany.  They were taken to a woodland site and murdered by guards.  Civilians of the town were ordered by American troops to bury victims in the city cemetery.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Jewish slave laborer killed by Nazi guards
Scopenote: The battered head of a Jewish slave laborer killed by Nazi guards in S. S. camp with other inmates at Neunburg.  Bodies were disinterred and reburied in Neunburg city cemetery by town's citizens.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Concentration camp inmates
Scopenote: Ebensee concentration camp inmates pose with the Austrian Alps in the background.  The camp was liberated by the 80th Division, 3rd United States Army.  From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Wobbelin concentration camp in Germany
Scopenote: Troops of the American 82nd Airborne Division view bodies of inmates at Wobbelin, a subcamp of the Neuengamme concentration camp. Germany, May 6, 1945.   From: album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: Dead prisoners at Ebensee, Austria
Scopenote: This is the crematorium with several rooms of dead bodies in the Nazi concentration camp at Ebensee, Austria.  Large numbers of the inmates were starving to death and dying at the rate of 2000 per week.  The camp was liberated by the 80th Division, 3rd U S Army.  From:  album entitled "Nazi War Atrocities."

title: President Truman Buys CARE Package to Feed Europe's Hungry People
Scopenote: In a Rose Garden ceremony at the White House, President Harry S. Truman hands a check for $1500 to Lt. General William N. Haskell to pay for 100 CARE packages of food to be sent to 10 heads of state in Europe for distribution among the hungry. Haskell is Executive Director of Cooperative for American Remittances to Europe, Inc. (CARE) a non-profit organization whose purpose is to supplement the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration (UNRRA) and act as a means for the whole country to provide a hungry person in Europe with food enough for three or four weeks. Received from: CARE.

Scopenote: Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson and Mr. Clark M. Clifford are met at Boca Chica by Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison as they arrive from Washington, D.C. for a few days visit with President Harry S. Truman at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Dennison, Vinson, and Clifford.

title: Chief Justice Vinson arriving to Key West
Scopenote: Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson is greeted by Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison (left) on his arrival at Boca Chica airport to join President Harry S. Truman's vacation party in Key West, Florida.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

Scopenote: Volley ball at Truman Beach, while President Harry S. Truman was on vacation in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Mr. Gerald A. Behn, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Mr. Clark M. Clifford, Commander Horace D. Warden, Mr. Stanley Woodward, Lieutenant Hoye D. Moore, Mr. Rex Scouten (partly obscured by Mr. Rowley), Mr. James J. Rowley, Mr. Henry J. Nicholson, and Major General Harry H. Vaughan.

Scopenote: Volley Ball at Truman Beach, while on vacation with President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Mr. Stanley Woodward, Mr. James J. Rowley, Mr. Clark M. Clifford, Mr. Gerald A. Behn, Lieutenant Hoye D. Moore, Mr. Rex Scouten, Mr. Henry J. Nicholson (partly obscured by Commander Warden), Commander Horace D. Warden, and Major General Harry H. Vaughan.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Dennison on board a submarine
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison (center) converses with crew members of Task Force 65 about anti-submarine warfare exercises off of Key West, Florida.  Admiral Dennison is a member of President Harry S. Truman vacation party in Key West.  Others are unidentified.  From: Robert L. Dennison

title: Admiral Dennison on board the U.S.S. Epperson
Scopenote: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison aboard the U.S.S. Epperson, off Key West, Florida.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Truman at party leaving to attend church
Scopenote: Sunday morning at 10:50 A.M. the President and some of his party prepare to leave the Little White House to attend Divine Services at the Naval Station Chapel, conducted by Chaplain Rennie. From left to right: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, President Harry S. Truman, Major General Harry H. Vaughan, and Mr. Stanley Woodward.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Louis Johnson returning to Washington, D.C.
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense, Mr. Louis A. Johnson (in white cap near open trunk of auto), arrives at the Naval Air Station in Key West (Boca Chica) to board his plane, which will return to Washington, D.C. Johnson came in from D.C. for a short conference with the President. He was accompanied to the Airport by Mr. Robert L. Dennison, Mr. Matt Connelly, and Captain Adell. Captain Quackenbush (far right, near ramp) stands by for this departure. From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: 8th Presidential Trip to Key West, FL
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense, Mr. Louis A. Johnson, (in white cap) left the Little White House for return to Washington, D.C. in his plane. From left to right: Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Brigadier General Robert B. Landry, Mr. Johnson, and Mr. Charles G. Ross, Press Secretary.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Gordon Gray leaving Little White House
Scopenote: Mr. Gordon Gray (center), Secretary of the Army, departs the Little White House to return to Washington, D.C. The Secretary was met at the Naval Air Station in Key West (Boca Chica) by Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison (left), and Major General Harry H. Vaughan (right). The Secretary arrived at the Little White House at 12:20 P.M., had lunch with the President at 1:00 P.M., conferred with the President in the north garden of the Little White House until 2:15 P.M. and at 2:35 P.M. departed the Little White House for Boca Chica. Admiral Dennison and General Vaughan accompanied him to Boca Chica for his departure.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Press Conference in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holding a press conference on the lawn of the Little White House. Standing from left to right: Mr. Phil Regan, Mr. David K. Niles, Mr. Stephen T. Spingarn, Mr. Stanley Woodward, Mr. Donald S. Dawson, Mr. Matthew J. Connelly, Major General Harry H. Vaughan, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Mr. William D. Hassett, unidentified, Major General Wallace H. Graham, and Mr. Charles G. Ross. The man writing on his knee next to Mr. Ross is Edwin W. Darby. Identifiable men sitting around President Harry S. Truman (center, in white chair) are Mr. Frank Bourgholtzer (third from left), Mr. Joseph H. Short, Jr. (wearing glasses), Mr. Joseph A. Fox (leaning in, in white suit) Mr. Robert G. Nixon (smoking cigar), Mr. Merriman Smith (partly obscured by Nixon), and Mr. Jack Romagna (in white long-sleeved shirt next to Truman). From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Mrs. Truman and Margaret arrive for vacation
Scopenote: Major General Harry H. Vaughan and Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison met Mrs. Bess Truman and Ms. Margaret Truman at the railroad station in Miami, FL, and accompanied them on an automobile drive to Key West where they joined the President Harry S. Truman at the Little White House. Left to right: Major General Vaughan, Mrs. Truman, Ms. Margaret Truman, and Rear Admiral Dennison.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Lunch on the lawn of the Little White House
Scopenote: A 2:00 P.M. Sunday luncheon on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida, for the President and his party. Left to right, clockwise starting at the extreme left: President Harry S. Truman, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Mr. Donald S. Dawson, Mr. Stephen T. Spingarn, Mr. Charles G. Ross, Mr. William D. Hassett, Ms. Margaret Truman (hidden by palm tree), Brigadier General Wallace D. Graham, Brigadier General Robert B. Landry, Major General Harry H. Vaughan, Mrs. Bess Truman, and Mr. Stanley Woodward.  From: Robert L. Dennison

title: Trumans on lawn of Little White House
Scopenote: A 2:00 P.M. Sunday luncheon on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida for the President and his party. From left to right: Mrs. Bess Truman, Mr. Stanley Woodward, President Harry S. Truman, and Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Truman awaiting the return of the picket boat
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the South Quay Wall near the bow of the U.S.S. Williamsburg awaiting the return of Mr. William D. Hassett's and Commander Horace D. Warden's fishing party, arriving in the picket boat. Lieutenant Hoye D. Moore, back to camera, is talking to Commander Warden (cap) and Mr. Hassett (obscured by Moore) who are still on the picket boat. Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison is talking to President Truman (in white cap and colorful shirt). Ms. Margaret Truman is cranking up her Polaroid Land Camera Model 95 for some 1-minute pictures.   From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Truman and Margaret watching boat arrive
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the North Quay Wall awaiting the returning members of Mr. William D. Hassett's and Commander Horace D. Warden's fishing party arriving in the picket boat. From left to right: Lieutenant Hoye D. Moore, President Truman (white cap), Ms. Margaret Truman, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, and Major General Robert B. Landry. On the stern of the picket boat operating his Argoflex camera is Commander Horace D. Warden.

title: Truman inspecting the catch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Ms. Margaret Truman come down to the North Quay Wall to inspect the 'catch' of fish from Mr. William D. Hassett's and Commander Horace D. Warden's fishing party. From left to right: Mr. Hassett, Brigadier General Robert B. Landry, President Truman, Lieutenant Hoye D. Moore, Ms. Truman, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Captain H. V. Pifer, and Commander Donald J. MacDonald.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Volleyball game on Truman Beach
Scopenote: Volleyball game at Truman Beach, while on vacation with President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida. Left to right on the court: Major General Harry H. Vaughan, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, and Commander Horace D. Warden. Others are unidentified.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: Group photo of President Truman's party, Key West
Scopenote: Group shot of the Presidential party for the 8th trip to Key West, FL. Front row (left to right): Mr. John R. Steelman, Mrs. Bess Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Ms. Margaret Truman, and Mr. William D. Hassett. Back row (left to right): Mr. Stephen T. Spingarn, Mr. Robert B. Landry, Mr. Robert L. Dennison, Mr. Stanley Woodward, Mr. Charles G. Ross, Mr. Harry H. Vaughan, Mr. Wallace H. Graham, and Mr. David K. Niles.

title: Truman inspecting Marine detachment
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the scene where he has just inspected the Naval Base Marine Detachment under the command of Major Harold A. Hayes, Jr. Members of the inspection party were (from left to right): Major General Harry H. Vaughan, Brigadier General Robert B. Landry, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Brigadier General Wallace H. Graham, and President Truman.  From: Robert L. Dennison

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Depart Key West
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) and President Harry S. Truman (second from left) pose for photographers as they board the US Air Force Constellation, "Dew Drop" for their return to Washington, D.C. ending the President's four week vacation at the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  Alongside the plane are President Truman's valet, Arthur S. Prettyman (second from right), and unidentified guard.  From: Robert L. Dennison.

title: The Independence, the Presidential airplane
Scopenote: Presidential airplane, The Independence. From an album of photographs of the visit of President Harry S. Truman to Wake Island for a conference with General Douglas MacArthur.  General MacArthur's plane, SCAP, follows the Independence in take-off.

title: President Truman and General MacArthur
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur at President Truman's arrival at the Wake Island Conference.

title: Dr. Henry Bennett and Men at Forge, Point 4 Program
Scopenote: Dr. Henry Bennett (center) visiting men at a forge, relating to the Point Four program. This is from a series of photos of the activities of Dr. Bennett in relation to the Program of Cooperation of the Point Four. Photos were taken in Italy, Greece, and the middle east, including Egypt. The location of this photo is unknown.

title: Dr. Henry Bennett Visiting Hospital, Point 4 Program
Scopenote: Dr. Henry Bennett, Director of the Point 4 program, is visiting a hospital in an unidentified country. Dr. Bennett is third from left. Photos were taken in Italy, Greece, and the Middle East, including Egypt.

title: Dr. Henry Bennett with Women and Chickens, Point 4 Program
Scopenote: Dr. Henry Bennett (third from left) with a group of women and chickens.  This photo is from a group of photos connected to Dr. Bennett's Program of Cooperation of Point Four.  The photos were taken in Italy, Greece, and the Middle East including Egypt.  This location is unidentified.

title: Portrait of Frank Pace
Scopenote: Photograph of Frank Pace, Jr., taken in Yokosuka, Japan, on his tour of the Far East. He had been Special Assistant to the U.S. Attorney General, Taxation Division, 1946; Executive Assistant to the U.S. Postmaster General, 1946-1948; Assistant Director, Bureau of the Budget, 1948-1949; Director, Bureau of the Budget, 1949-1950; and Secretary of the Army, 1950-1953.

Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq is greeted by Vincent R. Impellitteri, Mayor of New York City. From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

Scopenote: Jackie Robinson, a star player for the Brooklyn Dodgers, interviews His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq after a baseball game. Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq are entertained at a dinner given in their honor by Thomas J. Watson, President of the International Business Machines Corporation.  Pictured from left to right Prince Abdul-Ilah, King Faisal II, and Thomas J. Watson.  From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 8 to September 12, 1952."

title: King Faisal II of Iraq viewing the Declaration of Independence and the Constitution
Scopenote: At the Library of Congress, His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq is shown the Declaration of Independence and the Constitution of the United States. Scopenote: At the Ford Tank Plant in Detroit, Michigan, His Majesty King Faisal II, Al-Hashimi of Iraq, drives the new T-46 tank.  From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

title: King Faisal II and Prince Abdul-Ilah meet with Iraqi students
Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq, meet the Iraqi students at the Bureau of Reclamation Laboratory.  From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952.

title: King Faisal II and Prince Abdul-Ilah pictured at Stead's Ranch
Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq, with their party stops at Stead's Ranch in Estes Park, Colorado.  Prince Abdul-Ilah is the second man on the front row and King Faisal II is to his right.  From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

title: Portrait of Martha Ann Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of Martha Ann Truman (Mrs. James Swoyer, Jr.), daughter of J. Vivian Truman.

Scopenote: A county agricultural agent near Puno, Peru shows farmers how to inoculate alpacas for the control of internal parasites as part of a program sponsored by the Point Four Program. All are unidentified.

title: Baby Chicks in Peru

title: King Faisal II speaks with Ernest A. Gross
Scopenote: Ernest A. Gross, Deputy United States Representative to the United Nations, is host at a dinner given in honor of His Majesty King Faisal, II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq.  From photograph album, "Visit of His Majesty the King of Iraq and His Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

title: King Faisal II at the Continental Divide marker
Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and Sheik Ahmed at the Continental Divide marker in Colorado.  From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 87, 1952."

title: King Faisal II viewing the Rocky Mountains
Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq viewing the Rocky Mountains near Milner Pass, Colorado. From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq, photographing San Francisco Bay. title: King Faisal II of Iraq watches a baseball game at the Polo Grounds
Scopenote: From the owner's box, His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq watches a baseball game at the Polo Grounds in New York City. Scopenote: The planning of programs and the control of schedules for radio and television broadcasts is described to His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq. title: King Faisal II cruising Chesapeake Bay
Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq, sail the Royonto during a cruise on Chesapeake Bay. Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq meets Martha Wright, the star of "South Pacific," after a performance. From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

title: King Faisal II and Prince Abdul-Ilah outside the Mosque in Washington
Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq accompanied by His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq, and other distinguished visitors tours the mosque under construction in Washington.  From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

title: A reception in Detroit for King Faisal II and Prince Adul-Ilah
Scopenote: The Iraqi community of Detroit gives a reception in honor of His Majesty King Faisal II AL-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq.  From photograph album, "Visit of his Majesty the King of Iraq and his Royal Highness the Regent of Iraq to the United States of America, August 12 to September 8, 1952."

Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq, arrive in New York. Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq and His Royal Highness Prince Abdul-Ilah, Regent of Iraq, look at a wall map of the Continental Divide region while visiting the Granby Power Station, Colorado. Scopenote: His Majesty King Faisal II Al-Hashimi of Iraq serves himself with chopsticks during dinner at the Quo Wah Restaurant. title: Constructing a Well in Iran
Scopenote: Near the village of Mayan, Iran, unidentified villagers are harvesting building materials from an ancient caravan station to construct a standpipe for a well. The shallow well was constructed with the assistance of the Point Four program and the Technical Cooperation Administration so that villagers would have a better source of clean water.

title: Constructing a Well Standpipe in Iran
Scopenote: Near the village of Mayan, Iran, unidentified villagers are constructing a standpipe for a well, using reclaimed bricks and an old gasoline truck tank as a water reservoir. The shallow well was constructed with the assistance of the Point Four program and the Technical Cooperation Administration so that villagers would have a better source of clean water.

title: Water Station in Iran
Scopenote: The village of Mayan, Iran has a more modern, sanitary water system, with faucets such as this every few hundred feet throughout the village. This water system, an improvement over the seepage from a polluted creek, was built with the assistance of the Point Four Program and the Technical Cooperation Administration.

title: A crowd gathered in front of the Truman home in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A crowd gathered in front of the home of former president Harry S. Truman in Independence, Missouri.

title: Women Waiting at a Clinic in Tehran
Scopenote: Mothers wait with their children outside a clinic in Tehran, Iran, which was established with the assistance of the Point Four Program. A doctor from the Ministry of Health visits the clinic twice a week and treats patients and helps train Iranian girls as health visitors. All women in the photo are unidentified.

title: Searching for Water in Iran
Scopenote: A group of unidentified men with donkeys carrying small tanks for gathering water. Before the Point Four program arrived in Iran, the village of Mayan obtained its water from seepage to shallow potholes from a polluted creek near the village. The village landlord decided to cooperate with the Point Four program to get residents better water.
